Sean k+1 variables, con $n$ observaciones cada una:

$$
\begin{matrix}
y & x_{1} & x_{2} & \cdots & x_{k} \\
\hline
y_1 & x_{11} & x_{21} & \cdots  & x_{k1} \\
y_2 & x_{12} & x_{22} & \cdots  & x_{k2} \\
\cdots &\cdots & \cdots & \cdots  & \cdots \\
y_n & x_{1n} & x_{2n} & \cdots  & x_{kn} \\
\end{matrix}
$$

se define la covarianza entre las variables $x_j$ e $y$ como

$$
cov(x_{j},y) = S_{jy} = \frac{\sum_{i}(x_{ji} - \bar x_j)(y_i - \bar y)}{n-1}, \quad j \in [1,k], \quad i \in [1,n]
$$

y la covarianza entre las variables $x_r$ e $x_s$ como

$$
cov(x_{j},x_{k}) = S_{jk} = \frac{\sum_{i}(x_{ji} - \bar x_j)(x_{ki} - \bar x_{k})}{n-1}, \quad j \in [1,k], \quad i \in [1,n]
$$
